message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of mitigating choice overload in the online marketplace, which is a common problem in information retrieval (IR). The proposed method involves creating hierarchical item categories from implicit feedback data, which is a machine learning (ML) task. The paper also discusses the use of this item hierarchy in making category-based recommendations, which is a common problem in ML. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

The paper also involves the use of hierarchical latent tree analysis (HLTA), which is a technique commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) and text analysis. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is also a likely sub-category. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning algorithms, which can fall under several sub-categories. cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a likely sub-category. 

The paper also discusses the creation of an automatic item taxonomy skeleton, which involves the use of computational methods to create a taxonomy. Therefore, cs.CY (Computers and Society) is a possible sub-category. 

Finally, the paper discusses the use of implicit feedback data, which is a type of user behavior data. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is also a possible sub-category.
